newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico to launch new, more independent, tax agency.
newsitem.headline: Mexico to launch new, more independent, tax agency.

text.p: Mexico will launch a new tax agency on Tuesday replacing the under-secretariat for revenues at the Finance Ministry, officials said.
The so-called Tax Administration System (SAT) will be a quasi-independent unit of the Finance Ministry, with budgetary and managerial autonomy and full responsibility for tax collection.
The undersecretariat will be disbanded, and its head, Thomas Ruiz, will become president of the SAT.
Ruiz told a news conference the SAT aimed to increase tax inspection by 12 percent this year, carrying out 600,000 audits and other investigations.

He said one of its first tasks would be to carry out a survey of Mexico's 5.5 million contributors, to get a sense of how complex the tax process is, and "how easy it is considered at this moment for a taxpayer to evade taxes."
